meanings.definition: Make (something) ready for use or consideration.
meanings.sent1: She prepares her backpack for school every morning.
meanings.sent2: He prepares a delicious meal for his family every Sunday.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel prepares for winter by gathering nuts.
meanings.sent4: The coach prepares the team for the championship game.
meanings.sent5: The diligent student prepares for the exam by studying hard.

meanings.definition: Get (something) ready for use or consideration.
meanings.sent1: Mom prepares the ingredients before baking a cake.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic prepares the car for a long road trip.
meanings.sent3: The magician prepares his tricks before the show.
meanings.sent4: The teacher prepares the classroom for the new school year.
meanings.sent5: The chef prepares the menu for the restaurant opening.

meanings.definition: Make (someone) ready or able to do or deal with something.
meanings.sent1: The coach prepares the athletes for the upcoming competition.
meanings.sent2: She prepares her students for the difficult exam ahead.
meanings.sent3: The superhero prepares to face the villain in an epic battle.
meanings.sent4: The mentor prepares the young entrepreneur for success in business.
meanings.sent5: The parent prepares the child for the challenges of adulthood.
